abstract.text: Objects conforming to STPFormEncodable can be automatically converted to a form-encoded string, which can then be used when making requests to the Stripe API.

This maps properties on an object that is being form-encoded into parameter names in the Stripe API. For example, STPCardParams has a field called
, but the Stripe API expects a field called
. This dictionary represents a mapping from the former to the latter (in other words, STPCardParams.propertyNamesToFormFieldNamesMapping()[“expMonth”] == “exp_month”.)

There are currently no parameters to pass.

The root object name to be used when converting this object to a form-encoded string. For example, if this returns “card”, then the form-encoded output will resemble “card[foo]=bar” (where ‘foo’ and ‘bar’ are specified by
below.

Representation of a user’s credit card details. You can assemble these with
information that your user enters and then create Stripe tokens with them using
an STPAPIClient.
The user’s card details.
An object representing parameters used to create an AU BECS Debit Payment Method

You can use this property to add additional fields to an API request that are not explicitly defined by the object’s interface. This can be useful when using beta features that haven’t been added to the Stripe SDK yet. For example, if the /v1/tokens API began to accept a beta field called “test_field”, you might do the following:
var cardParams = STPCardParams()
// add card values
cardParams.additionalAPIParameters = [“test_field”: “example_value”]
STPAPIClient.shared.createToken(withParameters: cardParams completion:…);
An object representing parameters used to create a giropay Payment Method
An object representing parameters to confirm a SetupIntent object.
For example, you would confirm a SetupIntent when a customer hits the “Save” button on a payment method management view in your app.
If the selected payment method does not require any additional steps from the customer, the SetupIntent’s status will transition to
.  Otherwise, it will transition to
, and suggest additional actions via
Instead of passing this to
directly, we recommend using
to handle any additional steps for you.

PaymentSheet is a prebuilt UI that combines all the steps required to pay - collecting payment details, billing details, and confirming the payment - into a single sheet that displays on top of your app.
